label: TicktickApi
description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the ticktick API.

tools.name: CreateProjectInTicktick
tools.description:
Create a new project in Ticktick with optional properties.

Use this tool to create a new project in Ticktick. You can specify the project's name and other optional properties such as color, sort order, view mode, and kind (TASK or NOTE).

parameters.name: project_name
parameters.description: Name of the project to be created. This is a required field.

parameters.name: project_color
parameters.description: Hex color code representing the project's color (e.g., '#F18181').

parameters.name: project_kind
parameters.description: Specifies the type of items the project will store. Choose 'TASK' for tasks or 'NOTE' for notes.

parameters.name: project_sort_order
parameters.description: The integer value representing the project's sort order.

parameters.name: project_view_mode
parameters.description: The display mode for the project: choose from 'list', 'kanban', or 'timeline'.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: CreateTaskTicktick
tools.description:
Create a new task in Ticktick with specified properties.

Use this tool to create a new task in Ticktick by specifying title, content, dates, reminders, subtasks, and the project it belongs to.

Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
the stringified JSON input object for execution.

Modes:
- GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
  already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
  the schema.
- EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
  JSON.

If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

request_body.value: {"title": "Complete Project Report", "content": "Draft the final report for the project and ensure all sections are covered.", "due_date": "2023-10-30T17:00:00Z", "reminders": [{"time": "2023-10-29T17:00:00Z"}], "subtasks": [{"title": "Research previous reports"}, {"title": "Gather data from team members"}], "project_id": "12345"}

tools.name: DeleteSpecificTask
tools.description:
Permanently delete a task using project and task IDs.

This tool is used to permanently remove a specific task by providing its project ID and task ID from Ticktick. Use this when you need to delete a task and ensure it is no longer available in the project.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the project containing the task to be deleted.

parameters.name: task_identifier_to_delete
parameters.description: The unique ID of the task to permanently delete from a project.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: DeleteTicktickProject
tools.description:
Permanently delete a project in Ticktick by ID.

Use this tool to permanently remove a specific project and all associated tasks from Ticktick by providing the project's ID. Ensure you no longer need the project, as this action cannot be undone.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the Ticktick project to permanently delete. Ensure the ID is correct, as this action cannot be undone.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetTicktickProjectById
tools.description:
Retrieve Ticktick project details by project ID.

This tool retrieves detailed information about a specific project in Ticktick using its ID. It provides the project's name, color, view mode, and kind.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the Ticktick project to retrieve.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetUserProjects
tools.description:
Retrieve all user-accessible projects from Ticktick.

This tool fetches a list of all projects that the authenticated user has access to in Ticktick. It should be called when a user wants to view or manage their projects within the platform.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: MarkTaskComplete
tools.description:
Marks a specific task as completed in Ticktick.

Use this tool to mark a task as completed in Ticktick, updating its status and setting the completion time.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: Unique ID of the project containing the task to be completed.

parameters.name: task_identifier
parameters.description: The unique ID of the task to be marked as completed.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: RetrieveProjectWithTasks
tools.description:
Retrieve detailed project information and all related tasks.

Call this tool to get a complete view of a project, including tasks and column configurations, especially useful for understanding project status and organization.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the project to retrieve with all data, including tasks and columns.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: RetrieveTaskDetails
tools.description:
Retrieve detailed information for a specific task.

Use this tool to get detailed information about a task by providing the project ID and task ID. It returns information including subtasks, reminders, and scheduling details.

parameters.name: project_identifier
parameters.description: The unique ID of the project containing the task to retrieve.

parameters.name: task_identifier
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the task to retrieve detailed information including subtasks and reminders.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: UpdateProjectProperties
tools.description:
Update properties of an existing project.

This tool updates various properties of an existing project, such as name, color, sort order, view mode, and kind. It should be used when changes to these attributes are needed for a project on Ticktick.

parameters.name: project_identifier
parameters.description: Unique ID of the project to update.

parameters.name: project_color
parameters.description: Hex color code representing the color of the project, such as '#FFFFFF'.

parameters.name: project_kind
parameters.description: Specify the type of project: TASK or NOTE.

parameters.name: project_name
parameters.description: The new name for the project to be updated. This should be a string representing the desired project name.

parameters.name: project_sort_order
parameters.description: Sort order value for the project, default is 0. Determines the project's position relative to others.

parameters.name: project_view_mode
parameters.description: Specifies the view mode of the project. Options are 'list', 'kanban', or 'timeline'.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: UpdateTaskProperties
tools.description:
Update a task's properties in Ticktick.

    Use this tool to update various properties of a task in Ticktick. It requires the task ID and project ID, while other fields are optional. Ideal for modifying task details such as status, title, or due date.

    Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
    the stringified JSON input object for execution.

This operation also requires path parameters.

    Modes:
    - GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
      already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
      the schema.
    - EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
      JSON.
      Note: You must also provide the required path parameters when executing.

    If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: task_identifier
parameters.description: The unique ID of the task to update in Ticktick. This is required to identify the specific task to be updated.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

<Callout type="info">
The TicktickApi MCP Server uses the Auth Provider with id `arcade-ticktick` to connect to users' TickTick accounts.
</Callout>

In order to use the MCP Server, you will need to configure the `arcade-ticktick` auth provider.

Learn how to configure the TickTick auth provider in the [TickTick auth provider documentation](/references/auth-providers/ticktick).
